article: How to Play Charades: Rules, Gestures, & More
intro: Charades is an action-packed guessing game that's fun and suitable for all ages. The game revolves around acting out a specific word or phrase, which is sure to get hilariously heated (in the best way possible). So, what are the rules of this classic party game, and how can you play it? Keep reading to learn how to play charades and make the most common charade gestures.

steps.title: Select the starting team with a coin toss and set a time limit.
steps.subtitle: Flip a coin to determine which team goes first. Each round usually has a set amount of time, but you can adjust this depending on the players' age group and skill level. Set a stopwatch or phone timer for 1 minute and go from there.
sub-points: Time limits aren’t necessary, especially if you’re playing with kids, but they can help the game run more smoothly.
If you’re not playing with a time limit, keep acting until the prompt is guessed correctly.
Consider agreeing on a penalty for anyone who speaks while gesturing or acting. For instance, teams may get a half-point deduction or forfeit the round.

steps.title: Use similar-sounding words to your advantage.
steps.subtitle: By cupping a hand to your ear, you signal to your team that you’re acting out a word that sounds like the prompt. For instance, if you point to your eye, you’re expressing that the word is “I.”
sub-points: Another example would be lying down on your back to pantomime the word “lying.”
